  • Constructor Details

    • Server

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start() throws RemoteException
      Starts the server by initializing both the socket-based and RMI-based components.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an issue occurs while setting up the RMI components.

    • startSocket

      private void startSocket()
      Initializes and starts the server socket to listen for incoming client connections. The method creates a server socket bound to port 4200 and manages client connections using a fixed thread pool with 8 threads. Incoming connections are handled by creating separate `SocketClientHandler` instances for each client.

    • startRMI

      private void startRMI() throws RemoteException
      Starts the RMI (Remote Method Invocation) server for the application.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an issue occurs during the initialization or binding of the RMI components.

    • subscribe

      public void subscribe(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Subscribes a client to the server. This method adds the given ClientHandler to the list of subscribed clients and logs the nickname of the subscribed client.
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the ClientHandler instance representing the client to be subscribed.

    • unsubscribe

      public void unsubscribe(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Unsubscribes a client from the server. This method removes the specified ClientHandler instance from the list of subscribed clients and logs the nickname of the unsubscribed client.
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the ClientHandler instance representing the client to be unsubscribed.

    • isSubscribed

      public boolean isSubscribed(ClientHandler clientHandler)

    • getSubscribedClient

      private ClientHandler getSubscribedClient(String nickname)
      Retrieves the subscribed ClientHandler associated with the given nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the client to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the ClientHandler instance associated with the given nickname, or null if no subscribed client with the specified nickname exists.

    • broadcastGameUpdate

      public void broadcastGameUpdate(List<String> nicknames, Game game)
      Broadcasts a game update to a list of subscribed clients. The method iterates through the provided list of nicknames, retrieves the associated ClientHandler for each nickname, and updates their game state with the provided Game.
      Parameters:
      nicknames - the list of nicknames identifying the clients to whom the game update should be broadcast.
      game - the updated Game instance to be sent to the clients.

    • broadcastLogs

      public void broadcastLogs(List<String> nicknames, List<String> logs)
      Broadcasts log messages to a list of subscribed clients identified by their nicknames. This method iterates over the provided list of nicknames, retrieves the corresponding ClientHandler for each nickname, and sends the given list of logs to those clients.
      Parameters:
      nicknames - the list of nicknames identifying the clients to whom the log messages should be broadcast.
      logs - the list of log messages to be sent to the subscribed clients.

    • broadcastJoinableGames

      public void broadcastJoinableGames(List<String> nicknames, List<Game.GameInfo> infos)
      Broadcasts information about joinable games to a list of subscribed clients. The method iterates through the provided list of nicknames, retrieves the associated ClientHandler for each nickname, and sends the list of Game.GameInfo instances representing joinable games to those clients.
      Parameters:
      nicknames - the list of nicknames identifying the clients to whom the joinable game information should be broadcast.
      infos - the list of Game.GameInfo instances containing details about the joinable games to be sent to the subscribed clients.
